Summary: Green and white light with orange fire/ jet flying very low, then just dissipated.
divs: Sighting DetailsJuly 25, 2010: After driving with my family from Colorado Springs, Colorado for around 12 hours, I had pulled off the road about 20 miles west of Delta, Utah on HWY 50. It was 4:15 a.m.. As I turned off my truck, my oldest son, and my girlfriend woke up. I was getting ready to take some of our things out of the cab of the truck, to make for more sleeping room, when I noticed what looked to be a low-flying airplane. I saw white with green lights moving easterly parallel to the highway. The trajectory seemed to be headed downwards around 10 to 15 degrees. I thought it was strange for an airplane to be flying at that time, in the middle of nowhere, but I just wrote it off as normal until a huge, orange jet-fire, for lack of a better description appeared from the back of the lights. The jet appeared very long. It didn't look like flames, but like a torch, or something. I don't recall any acceleration of the lights, but it just sort of dissipated, and was gone. There was no sound. I asked my girlfriend, and my son if they had seen this, and they saw the same thing. I don't know if it could have been a meteor, or any other describable object, but the jet-fire tells me it wasn't. A week later I asked my son and girlfriend to draw what they saw, and all of our drawings were pretty much the same.
